definition: to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
surname Li
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
opposite/antonym/the opposite side (in a conflict)

sentences.english: The antagonism of moralities is an important factor to influence world harmony.
sentences.chinese: 道德的对立是影响世界和谐的重要因素。

sentences.english: The opposite of acids are bases, or alkaloids.
As Mars moves opposite your sign, you could feel listless and depressed about love.
sentences.chinese: 火星与你对立，你可能对爱心生怠倦和沮丧。

sentences.english: Modern English empiricists take experience and natural as two opposed conceptions.
sentences.chinese: 英国近代经验论者，将经验和自然对立起来。

sentences.english: The tale wittily explores the interaction and tension between reality and imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这篇故事机智地探讨了现实和想象之间的联系和对立。

sentences.english: Each door opens onto another country. We readers have unprecedented rights of access to complementary and contradictory worlds.
sentences.chinese: 作为读者，我们有权进入互不相同或完全对立的世界。

sentences.english: On others, such as global warming, the two countries are at opposite ends of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 在全球变暖等其它问题上，两国更是处于对立的两级。

sentences.english: Crime and moral exist in a connective form of both contact and contradiction.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪与道德是互相对立而又相互联系的矛盾体。

sentences.english: It is time for opposing factions to unite and work towards a common goal.
sentences.chinese: 现在是各对立派联合起来为共同目标而奋斗的时候了。

sentences.english: The antagony between the necessity and freedom of nature is an original contradiction man faces.
sentences.chinese: 自然必然性与自由的对立，是人类面临的本原性矛盾。

sentences.english: But the epoch of the bourgeoisie simplified the class antagonisms.
sentences.chinese: 但是，资产阶级时代的新时代却使阶级对立简单化了。

sentences.english: He invents a special term to describe the opposite of autonomy.
sentences.chinese: 他发明了一个术语来描述自主的对立面。

sentences.english: Many people pose tradition and modernization as diametrically opposite.
sentences.chinese: 许多人将传统与现代化绝然对立起来。

sentences.english: The peace talks broke down completely, and the two opposing parties took up arms again.
sentences.chinese: 和平会谈彻底破裂，对立双方再起干戈。

definition: opposite/antonym/the opposite side (in a conflict)
hostile/enemy (factions)/combative
contradiction/CL:個|个[ge4]/conflicting views/contradictory
conflict/to conflict/clash of opposing forces/collision (of interests)/contention
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
either this or that/one or the other
completely incompatible/lit. incompatible as fire and water
as rivers Jing and Wei separate clearly (idiom)/to be entirely different
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
ideology
both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
completely/sharply (differing)
struggle/war
dividing line between distinct realms/boundary/field-allocation (in Chinese astrology, the association between celestial regions and corresponding terrestrial realms)
position/standpoint/CL:個|个[ge4]
